summary: Willem Oltmans was a person of interest due to his contacts with Cuban and Soviet diplomats. Cables from November 9, 1977, report on his meetings and contacts with these diplomats, as well as his travel to the USSR and potential travel to Cuba. His connection to George de Mohrenschildt is noted, making him relevant to Congressional committees investigating matters related to the JFK assassination. The documents suggest that information about Oltmans' activities and connections was considered important enough to be conveyed to Congressional authorities.
significance: Willem Oltmans' significance in the JFK context stems from his association with George de Mohrenschildt and his contacts with Cuban and Soviet diplomats. These connections raised concerns and prompted the reporting of his activities to Congressional committees, suggesting a potential link, however indirect, to matters being investigated related to the assassination.
